intro: Delphinium fissum, commonly known as the Alpine larkspur, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the mountainous regions of Europe and Asia. It typically grows to a height of 30–100 cm, featuring tall, erect stems covered with fine, soft hairs. The plant produces showy blue to purple flowers in late spring to early summer, arranged in dense spikes at the top of the stems. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often have a distinctive white or greenish vein pattern. Delphinium fissum is adapted to cold, alpine environments and is often found in meadows and rocky slopes at high elevations.
